intro: Telipogon teuscheri, commonly known as the Schomburgk's grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a small, tufted perennial grass that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is native to parts of South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
